entry.title: How to Include Overhead Costs in Product Costing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hello Community,

Iâ€™m currently working on a costing scenario in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and I would like your insights.

My situation is as follows:

  • I want to produce a Finished Good (FG) along with a Co-Product.

  • I have already generated the BOM of the FG, which contains the cost of each component.

  • I created the Work Center, assigned each Activity Type (Setup, Machine Time, Personnel Time), and determined the price of each activity type.

  • When I create the Cost Estimate of the product, I can see the direct material costs (from BOM) and the direct production costs (from activity types).

ðŸ‘‰ However, what I cannot see are the overhead costs (such as administration, sales, and other indirect costs).

My question to the community is:

  • How can I generate those overhead costs in the cost estimate within SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?

  • Which configuration steps do I need to follow?

  • Which applications (Fiori apps) are used to set this up and run the process?

Any guidance, best practices, or resources would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Profit center Difference in Round off Difference G/L when incoming payment F-28
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We config the round off difference when difference maximum 5 rupees. After that the profit center showing as below as two different profit centers. 
I tried to change the profit center but it automatically changed to default cost center & profit center.

We made OKB9 configs. but not working.

Any advice you all have.

entry.title: How the cost estimation will happen in Campaign orders
entry.content:
I am creating a campaign in PCA1 and adding normal orders with cleanout orders in it. 
Created 3 production version
1. Planning - one recipe and BOM which has all activities and materials needed for both production and cleanout.
2. Production - Has another recipe and BOM with only the activities and materials necessary for producing one batch.
3. Clean out order - Has activities and materials necessary for cleaning (water, solvents, electricity, labor). Will have separate recipe group
Here I need to understand how the standard cost estimate will happen.
Do we need costing done for all Production versions. In standard it allows Standard costing for only one production version.
If costing done only for planning version, will there be no actual cost in Production & Cleanout orders?
Do all the actual cost will be settled as variance.
If so all the cost from cleanout and production order will be settled as variance and loss?
What is the normal business process to handle this.

entry.title: Regroup Receivables / Payables - exchange rate issue in sap S/4HANA public cloud
entry.content:
Hello Expert,

We are using Regroup Receivables / Payables in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

while regrouping receivables more than 1 year old open items,  current month exchange rate is being selected for regroup posting, instead of exchange rate from actual invoice posting date.

But the receivables less than 1 year old open items, actual invoice posting date exchange rate is being selected for regroup posting.

Is this the standard behavior for more than 1 year old open items while regrouping?

Kindly let me know.

Thank you.

Regards,

Shrinivas

thank you

entry.title: Leave provision expense posting from HR-FI is appearing on the credit side instead of the debit side
entry.content:
Looking for help with the accounting entry while Leave provision for the employee and leave taken by the employee.

Current accounting entry as below for monthly accumulation as well as off-cycle while taking leaves

Leave provision expenses (PL) Dr 25

Leave provision (B/S) Cr 25

When the employee takes leave (let's assume 5 days)

Leave provision (B/S) Dr 5

Employee Cr 5

But there is a posting happening in the credit side of Leave provision expense account which was raised a concern by finance team. When we checked with HCM Consultant, they said its standard. It happens when an employee takes leave and current leave balance will be less than the previous month, which leads to a negative balance for that month and a credit value to the expense account will get posted. As per expectation from our finance team, when an employee takes leave, it should get adjusted from the Leave provision(B/S) account, which is paying out the liability by the company should not adjust in the expense.

Is it required to adjust with expense account in the monthly payroll while taking leave by employee? Is it standard/normal behavious in SAP which is postig credit value to the expense account when taking leaves? Would love to hear your thoughts hereâ€”really appreciate it

entry.title: T-code S_P00_07000134 report displays withholding tax certificate nos twice
entry.content:
Dear Friends,

User is having this problem,

After T-code S_P00_07000134 is executed, the report displays  withholding tax certificate no twice . for example - withholding tax certificate no - 509007 is displayed twice in the report.

How to find where the numbers range is getting pickup and how to rectify it? we are in ECC 6.0

All the help will be greatly appreciated.

.

Regards
Sridhar

entry.title: Assigning a new tax key for and VAT 26.000 not possible
entry.content:
Dear Friends,

This error is faced by the user. We are in ECC 6.0.

Could you please help me to setup below partners in SAP, so  vendor invoices are posted correctly? All below partners needs to recognize VAT at 26% rate and Tax code N3.

Vendor CoCode VAT Rate
258561 2489  26.000
257700 2489 26.000
245671 2489 26.000

Assigning a new tax key for and VAT 26.000 not possible

Message No. FD008

Diagnosis

In Financial Accounting customizing, the tax ID transferred in the invoice is missing so that the system cannot determine a tax code. The system could not determine an entry with the value nor with the value VAT 26.000.

Procedure

In Financial Accounting customizing, include the external tax ID and a corresponding internal tax code for the present partner.

Please suggest, what are the T.codes that needs to be checked and configured? 

Regards

Sridhar

entry.title: Custom Fields Added in TMR1,TM00,TX-3,TPM13 and S_ALR_87015205
entry.content:
Dear Team,

We have added two custom fields in the FTR_CREATE screen under the custom Additional tab and are saving the data in the VTBFHA table. The data is reflected correctly in the VTBFHA table and custom Append Structure VTMFHA

These two fields also need to be included in the following reports:

  • TMR1
  • TM00
  • TX-3
  • S_ALR_87015205
  • TPM13

Currently:

  • In TM00, the custom fields are displayed, and values are appearing correctly.
  • In the other reports mentioned above, the fields are not showing, and values are not appearing correctly.
  • Additionally, in TM00, the Dynamic Selection option is greyed out. Could you please advise me on how to activate the Dynamic Selection for this report?

Requesting your support to:

  1. Add the two custom fields in the above-listed reports.
  2. Help resolve the Dynamic Selection activation issue in TM00.

 I have attached detail document please refer to attached and provide the your valuable solution

entry.title: How to pull last 14 digits of IBAN number to the Account ID tag in DME
entry.content:
Hello experts...

Need to pull the last 14 digits of the IBAN to the account Id tag in DME.

Eg:

IBAN: DK7920004374752125

ID: 20004374752125 (last 14 digits of the IBAN).

I have done the config as below: 

conversation function tried both left justified and right justified.

still, it is picking first 14 digits of the IBAN not Last 14 digits.

 

Please help me how to bring last 14 digits (20004374752125) to the Id tag in the DME.

 

Thanks,

Kavitha D
